messages.message: Hi team, do we have an plans for a customer facing API that would return system status? A customer is asking if there is something they can use to poll for status. I am thinking we might have something through ICC that would be a programatic representation of what is on the status page. Does that make sense? Thanks in advance. cc @Daniel Campo
I'm guessing this is for on prem? Do you have more details on why an API would be helpfu/useful here? They can directly check the platform status through DM as of now

Not for on-prem (then they would be able to get it themselves) but for SaaS AI Hub. They have an external monitoring system that checks periodically and alerts.

They specifically asked if there was a supported API for this, and I'm not aware of one. I suggested we could use any of the other APIs and look for a success as a proxy.

We don't have a customer facing API for that right now. ICC does show the platform status but even that can be manually overridden by on call depending on the situation. If we provided an API that reflected exactly what the platform status is at every point in time, allowing them to poll our platform - I can imagine a scenario where we would get a lot of potentially false negatives or flakiness.

Better to leave monitoring and alerting to on call and alert/notify the customer when there is a true degradation rather than giving the customer free reign on polling our platform for this

Most status pages provide a mechanism to "Subscribe to updates" which is what our customers are looking for. This provides a way for customers to understand:
• When incidents are *created*, *updated* or resolved
• When maintenance starts and finishes
That’s still better than giving the customer an API to poll our systems. These are two fundamentally different approaches
Yes agree - I think we should provide the notification approach - this is very standard
